00079 class TiXmlBase
00080 {
00081     friend class TiXmlNode;
00082     friend class TiXmlElement;
00083     friend class TiXmlDocument;
00084  
00085   public:
00086     TiXmlBase()                             {}  
00087     virtual ~TiXmlBase()                    {}
00088     
00094     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const = 0;
00095 
00096     // [internal] Underlying implementation of the operator <<
00097     virtual void StreamOut ( std::ostream* out ) const = 0;
00098 
00105     static void SetCondenseWhiteSpace( bool condense )      { condenseWhiteSpace = condense; }
00106 
00108     static bool IsWhiteSpaceCondensed()                     { return condenseWhiteSpace; }
00109 
00110   protected:
00111     static const char* SkipWhiteSpace( const char* );
00112     static bool StreamWhiteSpace( std::istream* in, std::string* tag );
00113     static bool IsWhiteSpace( int c )       { return ( isspace( c ) || c == '\n' || c == '\r' ); }
00114 
00115     /*  Read to the specified character.
00116         Returns true if the character found and no error.
00117     */
00118     static bool StreamTo( std::istream* in, int character, std::string* tag );
00119 
00120     /*  Reads an XML name into the string provided. Returns
00121         a pointer just past the last character of the name, 
00122         or 0 if the function has an error.
00123     */
00124     static const char* ReadName( const char*, std::string* name );
00125 
00126     /*  Reads text. Returns a pointer past the given end tag.
00127         Wickedly complex options, but it keeps the (sensitive) code in one place.
00128     */
00129     static const char* ReadText(    const char* in,             // where to start
00130                                     std::string* text,          // the string read
00131                                     bool ignoreWhiteSpace,      // whether to keep the white space
00132                                     const char* endTag,         // what ends this text
00133                                     bool ignoreCase );          // whether to ignore case in the end tag
00134 
00135     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p ) = 0;
00136 
00137     // If an entity has been found, transform it into a character.
00138     static const char* GetEntity( const char* in, char* value );
00139 
00140     // Get a character, while interpreting entities.
00141     inline static const char* GetChar( const char* p, char* value )     
00142                                             {       
00143                                                 assert( p );
00144                                                 if ( *p == '&' ) 
00145                                                 {
00146                                                     return GetEntity( p, value );
00147                                                 }
00148                                                 else 
00149                                                 {
00150                                                     *value = *p;
00151                                                     return p+1;
00152                                                 }
00153                                             }
00154 
00155     // Puts a string to a stream, expanding entities as it goes.
00156     // Note this should not contian the '<', '>', etc, or they will be transformed into entities!
00157     static void PutString( const std::string& str, std::ostream* stream );
00158 
00159     // Return true if the next characters in the stream are any of the endTag sequences.
00160     bool static StringEqual(    const char* p, 
00161                                 const char* endTag, 
00162                                 bool ignoreCase );
00163                                                     
00164 
00165     enum
00166     {
00167         TIXML_NO_ERROR = 0,
00168         TIXML_ERROR,
00169         TIXML_ERROR_OPENING_FILE,
00170         TIXML_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY,
00171         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_ELEMENT,
00172         TIXML_ERROR_FAILED_TO_READ_ELEMENT_NAME,
00173         TIXML_ERROR_READING_ELEMENT_VALUE,
00174         TIXML_ERROR_READING_ATTRIBUTES,
00175         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_EMPTY,
00176         TIXML_ERROR_READING_END_TAG,
00177         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_UNKNOWN,
00178         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_COMMENT,
00179         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_DECLARATION,
00180         TIXML_ERROR_DOCUMENT_EMPTY,
00181 
00182         TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT
00183     };
00184     static const char* errorString[ TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT ];
00185 
00186   private:
00187     struct Entity
00188     {
00189         const char*     str;
00190         unsigned int    strLength;
00191         int             chr;
00192     };
00193     enum
00194     {
00195         NUM_ENTITY = 5,
00196         MAX_ENTITY_LENGTH = 6
00197 
00198     };
00199     static Entity entity[ NUM_ENTITY ];
00200     static bool condenseWhiteSpace;
00201 };

00210 class TiXmlNode : public TiXmlBase
00211 {
00212   public:
00213 
00229     friend std::ostream& operator<< ( std::ostream& out, const TiXmlNode& base )
00230     {
00231         base.StreamOut( &out );
00232         return out;
00233     }
00234 
00238     friend std::istream& operator>> ( std::istream& in, TiXmlNode& base )
00239     {
00240         std::string tag;
00241         tag.reserve( 8 * 1000 );
00242         base.StreamIn( &in, &tag );
00243         
00244         base.Parse( tag.c_str() );
00245         return in;
00246     }
00247

00381     TiXmlDocument* GetDocument() const;

00384     bool NoChildren() const                     { return !firstChild; }
00385 
00386     TiXmlDocument* ToDocument() const       { return ( this && type == DOCUMENT ) ? (TiXmlDocument*) this : 0; } 
00387     TiXmlElement*  ToElement() const        { return ( this && type == ELEMENT  ) ? (TiXmlElement*)  this : 0; } 
00388     TiXmlComment*  ToComment() const        { return ( this && type == COMMENT  ) ? (TiXmlComment*)  this : 0; } 
00389     TiXmlUnknown*  ToUnknown() const        { return ( this && type == UNKNOWN  ) ? (TiXmlUnknown*)  this : 0; } 
00390     TiXmlText*     ToText()    const        { return ( this && type == TEXT     ) ? (TiXmlText*)     this : 0; } 
00391     TiXmlDeclaration* ToDeclaration() const { return ( this && type == DECLARATION ) ? (TiXmlDeclaration*) this : 0; } 
00392 
00393     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const = 0;
00394 
00395     // The real work of the input operator.
00396     virtual void StreamIn( std::istream* in, std::string* tag ) = 0;
00397 
00398   protected:
00399     TiXmlNode( NodeType type );
00400 
00401     // The node is passed in by ownership. This object will delete it.
00402     TiXmlNode* LinkEndChild( TiXmlNode* addThis );
00403 
00404     // Figure out what is at *p, and parse it. Returns null if it is not an xml node.
00405     TiXmlNode* Identify( const char* start );
00406 
00407     void CopyToClone( TiXmlNode* target ) const { target->value = value; }
00408

00413     TiXmlNode*      lastChild;

00418     TiXmlNode*      next;

00431 class TiXmlAttribute : public TiXmlBase
00432 {
00433     friend class TiXmlAttributeSet;
00434 
00435   public:
00437     TiXmlAttribute() : prev( 0 ), next( 0 ) {}
00438 
00440     TiXmlAttribute( const std::string& _name, const std::string& _value )   : name( _name ), value( _value ), prev( 0 ), next( 0 ) {}
00441 
00442     const std::string& Name()  const { return name; }       
00443 
00444     const std::string& Value() const { return value; }      
00445     const int          IntValue() const;                    
00446     const double       DoubleValue() const;                 
00447 
00448     void SetName( const std::string& _name )    { name = _name; }       
00449     void SetValue( const std::string& _value )  { value = _value; }     
00450     void SetIntValue( int value );                                      
00451     void SetDoubleValue( double value );                                
00452 
00454     TiXmlAttribute* Next() const;
00456     TiXmlAttribute* Previous() const;
00457 
00458     bool operator==( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs ) const { return rhs.name == name; }
00459     bool operator<( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name < rhs.name; }
00460     bool operator>( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name > rhs.name; }
00461 
00462     /*  [internal use] 
00463         Attribtue parsing starts: first letter of the name
00464                          returns: the next char after the value end quote
00465     */  
00466     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00467 
00468     // [internal use] 
00469     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00470 
00471     // [internal use] 
00472     virtual void StreamOut( std::ostream* out ) const;
00473 
00474     // [internal use]
00475     // Set the document pointer so the attribute can report errors.
00476     void SetDocument( TiXmlDocument* doc )  { document = doc; }
00477 
00478   private:
00479     TiXmlDocument*  document;   // A pointer back to a document, for error reporting.
00480     std::string     name;
00481     std::string     value;
00482 
00483     TiXmlAttribute* prev;
00484     TiXmlAttribute* next;
00485 };

00487 
00488 /*  A class used to manage a group of attributes.
00489     It is only used internally, both by the ELEMENT and the DECLARATION.
00490     
00491     The set can be changed transparent to the Element and Declaration
00492     classes that use it, but NOT transparent to the Attribute 
00493     which has to implement a next() and previous() method. Which makes
00494     it a bit problematic and prevents the use of STL.
00495 
00496     This version is implemented with circular lists because:
00497         - I like circular lists
00498         - it demonstrates some independence from the (typical) doubly linked list.
00499 */
00500 class TiXmlAttributeSet
00501 {
00502   public:
00503     TiXmlAttributeSet();
00504     ~TiXmlAttributeSet();
00505 
00506     void Add( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00507     void Remove( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00508 
00509     TiXmlAttribute* First() const   { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00510     TiXmlAttribute* Last()  const   { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00511     
00512     TiXmlAttribute* Find( const std::string& name ) const;
00513 
00514   private:
00515     TiXmlAttribute sentinel;
00516 };
00517

00523 class TiXmlElement : public TiXmlNode
00524 {
00525   public:
00527     TiXmlElement( const std::string& value );
00528 
00529     virtual ~TiXmlElement();
00530 
00534     const std::string* Attribute( const std::string& name ) const;
00535 
00539     const std::string* Attribute( const std::string& name, int* i ) const;
00540 
00544     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, 
00545                        const std::string& value );
00546 
00550     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, 
00551                        int value );
00552 
00555     void RemoveAttribute( const std::string& name );
00556 
00557     TiXmlAttribute* FirstAttribute() const  { return attributeSet.First(); }        
00558     TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute() const   { return attributeSet.Last(); }     
00559 
00560     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returs it.
00561     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00562     // [internal use] 
00563     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00564     // [internal use] 
00565     virtual void StreamOut ( std::ostream* out ) const;
00566     // [internal use] 
00567     virtual void StreamIn( std::istream* in, std::string* tag );
00568 
00569   protected:
00570     /*  [internal use] 
00571         Attribtue parsing starts: next char past '<'
00572                          returns: next char past '>'
00573     */  
00574     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00575 
00576     /*  [internal use]
00577         Reads the "value" of the element -- another element, or text.
00578         This should terminate with the current end tag.
00579     */
00580     const char* ReadValue( const char* in );
00581     bool ReadValue( std::istream* in );
00582 
00583   private:
00584     TiXmlAttributeSet attributeSet;
00585 };

00590 class TiXmlComment : public TiXmlNode
00591 {
00592   public:
00594     TiXmlComment() : TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::COMMENT ) {}
00595     virtual ~TiXmlComment() {}
00596 
00597     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returs it.
00598     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00599     // [internal use] 
00600     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00601     // [internal use] 
00602     virtual void StreamOut ( std::ostream* out ) const;
00603     // [internal use] 
00604     virtual void StreamIn( std::istream* in, std::string* tag );
00605 
00606   protected:
00607     /*  [internal use] 
00608         Attribtue parsing starts: at the ! of the !--
00609                          returns: next char past '>'
00610     */  
00611     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00612 };

00617 class TiXmlText : public TiXmlNode
00618 {
00619   public:
00620     TiXmlText( const std::string& initValue )  : TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::TEXT ) { SetValue( initValue ); }
00621     virtual ~TiXmlText() {}
00622 
00623 
00624     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returns it.
00625     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00626     // [internal use] 
00627     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00628     // [internal use] 
00629     virtual void StreamOut ( std::ostream* out ) const;
00630     // [internal use]   
00631     bool Blank() const; // returns true if all white space and new lines
00632     /*  [internal use] 
00633         Attribtue parsing starts: First char of the text
00634                          returns: next char past '>'
00635     */  
00636     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00637     // [internal use]
00638     virtual void StreamIn( std::istream* in, std::string* tag );
00639 };

00703 class TiXmlUnknown : public TiXmlNode
00704 {
00705   public:
00706     TiXmlUnknown() : TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::UNKNOWN ) {}
00707     virtual ~TiXmlUnknown() {}
00708 
00709     // [internal use]   
00710     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;

00712     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00713     // [internal use] 
00714     virtual void StreamOut ( std::ostream* out ) const;
00715     // [internal use] 
00716     virtual void StreamIn( std::istream* in, std::string* tag );
00717 
00718   protected:
00719     /*  [internal use] 
00720         Attribute parsing starts: First char of the text
00721                          returns: next char past '>'

00731 class TiXmlDocument : public TiXmlNode
00732 {
00733   public:
00735     TiXmlDocument();
00737     TiXmlDocument( const std::string& documentName );
00738     
00739     virtual ~TiXmlDocument() {}
00740 
00745     bool LoadFile();
00747     bool SaveFile() const;
00749     bool LoadFile( const std::string& filename );
00751     bool SaveFile( const std::string& filename ) const;
00752 
00754     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00755 
00760     TiXmlElement* RootElement() const       { return FirstChildElement(); }
00761     
00763     bool Error() const                      { return error; }
00764 
00766     const std::string& ErrorDesc() const    { return errorDesc; }
00767 
00771     const int ErrorId() const               { return errorId; }
00772 
00774     void ClearError()                       { error = false; errorId = 0; errorDesc = ""; }
00775   
00777     void Print() const                              { Print( stdout, 0 ); }
00778 
00779     // [internal use] 
00780     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth = 0 ) const;
00781     // [internal use] 
00782     virtual void StreamOut ( std::ostream* out ) const;
00783     // [internal use]   
00784     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00785     // [internal use]   
00786     void SetError( int err ) {      assert( err > 0 && err < TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT );
00787                                     error   = true; 
00788                                     errorId = err;
00789                                     errorDesc = errorString[ errorId ]; }
00790     // [internal use] 
00791     virtual void StreamIn( std::istream* in, std::string* tag );
00792 
00793   protected:
00794 
00795   private:
00796     bool error;
00797     int  errorId;   
00798     std::string errorDesc;
00799 };
